visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render an area chart with the following specifications: Chart type: area, Chart title: 'stacking: percent, connectNulls: true', Axes and labels styling: Use default styling, Data series: Two series with data [1, 1, null, 1, 1, 1] and [1, 1, 1, null, 1, 1], Custom colors: None, Additional configurations: Set stacking to 'percent' and connectNulls to true.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render an area chart with specific settings. The chart type is set to 'area', and the title is 'stacking: percent, connectNulls: true'. The plotOptions for the area chart include 'connectNulls' set to true, which ensures that null data points are connected, and 'stacking' set to 'percent', which stacks the data series in a percentage format. The data series consist of two areas, each with specific data points that include null values to demonstrate the effect of the 'connectNulls' option. The chart is styled with default settings for axes and labels, and no custom colors are specified. Additional configurations such as chart margins, background, and legend are not explicitly set, so they will use Highcharts' default values.
